label: A5B3_oP16_26_a2c_a2b-001
title: Metastable Au$_{5}$Zn$_{3}$ Structure
comments:
(Iwasaki, 1965) found this structure to form metastably between $300^{\circ}$ and $600^{\circ}$.  Below $300^{\circ}$ it transforms into the ordered Au$_{5}$Zn$_{3}$ structure. 
 There is considerable disorder on most of the sites in this system, to wit: \begin{itemize} \item Site Au-I (2a) is 60\% gold and 40 \% zinc, \item Site Zn-I (2c) is 20\% gold and 80 \% zinc, \item Site Zn-II (2b) is 10\% gold and 90 \% zinc, \item Site Zn-III (2b) is 40\% gold and 60 \% zinc, \item Site Au-II (4c) is 85\% gold and 15 \% zinc, and \item Site Au-III (4c) is 100\% gold with no zinc. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 We label each site by its dominant component. 
 (Iwaskai, 1965) gave the lattice constants in kX units.  We used the conversion factor 1 kX = 1.00202{\AA}. (Wood, 1947). 
 The ICSD entry is from (Iwasaki, 1962).
